title: Ton Blanker
text:
Ton Blanker (born 15 September 1960) is a Dutch former professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> player.
Career.
Blanker started his career with <a href="AFC%20Ajax">Ajax</a> winning the <a href="1979%E2%80%9380%20Eredivisie">1979–80 Eredivisie</a>, and reaching the Semi-finals in the <a href="1979%E2%80%9380%20European%20Cup">1979–80 European Cup</a>, where he scored four goals against <a href="Helsingin%20Jalkapalloklubi">HJK Helsinki</a> in the first round, then a hat-trick against <a href="AC%20Omonia">Omonia</a> in the next round.
Afterwards, Blanker played abroad for <a href="Vit%C3%B3ria%20S.C.">Vitória de Guimarães</a>, <a href="Real%20Zaragoza">Real Zaragoza</a> and <a href="UD%20Salamanca">Salamanca</a>, then he eventually returned to <a href="Eredivisie">Eredivisie</a> to play for <a href="S.B.V.%20Excelsior">S.B.V. Excelsior</a> and <a href="FC%20Volendam">FC Volendam</a>.
After a short spell in the United States with <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Lazers">Los Angeles Lazers</a>, Blanker played two years in Belgium for <a href="Beerschot%20A.C.">Germinal Beerschot</a> and <a href="R.%20Cappellen%20F.C.">Cappellen</a>.
Personal life.
Blanker is married to Anita Heilker of the <a href="Dolly%20Dots">Dolly Dots</a>, they had a daughter, Robin.
